div.pre: 1469 Paphos district, 1945 Burial: c. 310 B.C. (M) Contents: 39+ AR Alexander III: 38 lifetime and early post. tetradr. (Amphipolis 7, Pella 2, Sardes 1, Miletus 1, Side 2, Citium 2, Salamis 2, Aradus 1, Ace 2, Babylon 14, unc. mints 4) Philip III: 1 tetradr. (Salamis?) Disposition: dispersed. Sotheby, Apr. 30- May 1, 1958, nos. 22-27, 97 Information from H. L. Haughton. No. 24b from his sale (as BMC no. 188) is not included in his notes and has been left out of the list above. Two coins of Ptolemy VI and Ptolemy VIII mentioned by Haughton are clearly intrusive
